text.p: -- Merrill Lynch raised its long-term rating on BMC Software to buy from accumulate, a market source said.
-- Merrill kept its near-term accumulate rating on the stock, the source said.
-- The analyst was not immediately available for comment.
-- Analyst Chris Shilakes said in a research note that the "fundamental outlook has changed to a more aggressive growth posture for the next 12-18 months.
"A restructuring of BMC's research and development process has enabled the company to increase its new product flow five-fold over its fiscal year 1993 rate."
He said that almost 70 new products are expected in the 1997 fiscal year which ends in March with a nearly equal number of products coming from the DB2 and IMS products and open systems offerings.
